articles.headline: Abu Zubaydah, Tortured Guantánamo Detainee, Makes Case for Release
articles.snippet: At a hearing, Mr. Zubaydah, who has been held for 14 years and was tortured by the C.I.A., said he posed no threat.
articles.abstract: At a hearing, Mr. Zubaydah, who has been held for 14 years and was tortured by the C.I.A., said he posed no threat.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Over 14 years in American custody, Abu Zubaydah has come to symbolize, perhaps more than any other prisoner, how fear of terrorism after the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks changed the United States.

articles.headline: Grad Students Win Right to Unionize in an Ivy League Case
articles.snippet: A ruling by the National Labor Relations Board involving students at Columbia opens the door for teaching assistants at private universities to organize.
articles.abstract: A ruling by the National Labor Relations Board involving students at Columbia opens the door for teaching assistants at private universities to organize.
articles.lead_paragraph: Punctuating a string of Obama-era moves to shore up labor rights and expand protections for workers, the National Labor Relations Board ruled Tuesday that students who work as teaching and research assistants at private universities have a federally backed right to unionize.

articles.headline: The Housing Market Is Finally Starting to Look Healthy
articles.snippet: Millennials are in the mood to buy, and homebuilders are starting to produce more of the starter houses they demand.
articles.abstract: Millennials are in the mood to buy, and homebuilders are starting to produce more of the starter houses they demand.
articles.lead_paragraph: It has been an excruciatingly long time coming, but the housing sector in the United States is finally getting healthy. Thank millennials and thank homebuilders who are starting to produce more of the starter houses young people demand.

articles.headline: Delphi and Mobileye to Produce System for Self-Driving Cars
articles.snippet: The companies said they expected to demonstrate their system in January at International CES and to begin production within two years.
articles.abstract: The companies said they expected to demonstrate their system in January at International CES and to begin production within two years.
articles.lead_paragraph: The race to build self-driving cars is becoming an increasingly crowded field.

articles.headline: Turing Pharmaceuticals Accused of Retaliating for Sex Assault Complaint
articles.snippet: The woman said she had been a candidate for chief executive but was told she would not be eligible after a founder of the company resigned.
articles.abstract: The woman said she had been a candidate for chief executive but was told she would not be eligible after a founder of the company resigned.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Martin Shkreli, the disgraced former executive of Turing Pharmaceuticals, smirked before the cameras at a congressional hearing in February, another executive sat calmly to his right, defending the company’s controversial pricing practices even as Mr. Shkreli took the Fifth Amendment.
articles.byline: By Katie Thomas and Andrew Pollack

articles.headline: ‘I Have a Black Son in Baltimore’: Anxious New Parents and an Era of Unease
articles.snippet: Bill Janu is white and a police detective. Shanna Janu is black and a lawyer. Their infant son is coming of age in a new time of racial turmoil.
articles.abstract: Bill Janu is white and a police detective. Shanna Janu is black and a lawyer. Their infant son is coming of age in a new time of racial turmoil.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — He assembled the crib and mounted the bookshelves. She unpacked the bedding and filled the closet with onesies and rompers. Then husband and wife stood in the nursery and worried. Bill Janu, a police officer, is white. Shanna Janu, a lawyer, is black. As they eagerly awaited their baby’s birth this spring, they felt increasingly anxious.

articles.headline: Apple Becomes a Green Energy Supplier, With Itself as Customer
articles.snippet: As a wholesaler, the company can cut power costs and carbon dioxide emissions. It will get much of its supply from a solar energy farm now being built.
articles.abstract: As a wholesaler, the company can cut power costs and carbon dioxide emissions. It will get much of its supply from a solar energy farm now being built.
articles.lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif. — The words are stenciled on the front of the Apple Store, a glass box sandwiched between a nondescript Thai restaurant and a CVS pharmacy in downtown Palo Alto: “This store runs on 100 percent renewable energy.”

articles.headline: Turkey’s Military Plunges Into Syria, Enabling Rebels to Capture ISIS Stronghold
articles.snippet: Syrian rebels, aided by Turkish tanks, planes and special forces, said they had taken control of Jarabulus, the last major Islamic State redoubt near Turkey’s border.
articles.abstract: Syrian rebels, aided by Turkish tanks, planes and special forces, said they had taken control of Jarabulus, the last major Islamic State redoubt near Turkey’s border.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — Turkey sent tanks, warplanes and special operations forces into northern Syria on Wednesday in its biggest plunge yet into the Syrian conflict, enabling Syrian rebels to take control of an important Islamic State stronghold within hours.
articles.byline: By Tim Arango, Anne Barnard and Ceylan Yeginsu

articles.headline: ‘No One Is Safe’: Zimbabwe Threatens to Seize Farms of Party Defectors
articles.snippet: In a nation where land is used as a tool of control, many former officials who were beneficiaries of seizures of white-owned farms now find themselves potential victims.
articles.abstract: In a nation where land is used as a tool of control, many former officials who were beneficiaries of seizures of white-owned farms now find themselves potential victims.
articles.lead_paragraph: BINDURA, Zimbabwe — Dozens of angry young men jumped off a truck in front of Agrippah Mutambara’s gate, shouting obscenities and threatening to seize his 530-acre farm in the name of Zimbabwe’s president. They tried to scale the fence, scattering only when he raised and cocked his gun.

articles.headline: Gawker’s Gone. Long Live Gawker.
articles.snippet: Even if you avoided Gawker.com, you can’t escape its influence. Elements of its tone, style, sensibility, business model and work flow have colonized just about every other media company.
articles.abstract: Even if you avoided Gawker.com, you can’t escape its influence. Elements of its tone, style, sensibility, business model and work flow have colonized just about every other media company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nine years ago, Peter Thiel, a wealthy and secretive Silicon Valley investor, read something about himself online that he didn’t appreciate. He apparently vowed revenge, eventually carrying out a plan to fund lawsuits against Gawker Media, the publisher that upset him, culminating this week with the shuttering of the flagship Gawker.com.

articles.headline: After Earthquake in Italy, ‘Half the Town No Longer Exists’
articles.snippet: Dust still swirled about the rubble piled waist-high in the town of Amatrice. Stunned survivors, some still in pajamas, wandered through the streets, unsure what to do.
articles.abstract: Dust still swirled about the rubble piled waist-high in the town of Amatrice. Stunned survivors, some still in pajamas, wandered through the streets, unsure what to do.
articles.lead_paragraph: AMATRICE, Italy — The chaos came in the middle of the night. People were screaming and dying in the darkness across Amatrice, a summer getaway in central Italy famous as the birthplace of a pasta dish made with tomatoes and pork cheeks.
